abstract.p: Josh McCall, executive vice president at Jack Morton Worldwide, owned by Interpublic Group of Companies, is being named to new posts of president and chief operating officer; Laura Shuler, senior vice president at Morton, is being promoted to new post of executive vice president for brand positioning; Lowe Lintas & Partners UK acquires majority stake in Broadway, marketing communications agency; financial terms undisclosed (S)

block.p: Changes are coming at two agencies owned by the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Josh McCall, an executive vice president at Jack Morton Worldwide, formerly known as the Jack Morton Company, is being named to the new posts of president and chief operating officer. Mr. McCall, 40, remains at the Boston office of Morton, which is based in New York and is part of the Allied Communications Group unit of Interpublic.
Changes are coming at two agencies owned by the Interpublic Group of Companies.

Josh McCall, an executive vice president at Jack Morton Worldwide, formerly known as the Jack Morton Company, is being named to the new posts of president and chief operating officer. Mr. McCall, 40, remains at the Boston office of Morton, which is based in New York and is part of the Allied Communications Group unit of Interpublic.
Also, Laura Shuler, 39, senior vice president for strategic development at Morton, who is based in New York, is being promoted to the new post of executive vice president for brand positioning.

And Lowe Lintas & Partners UK in London, part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic, acquired a majority stake in Broadway, a marketing communications agency also based in London. Terms were not disclosed. Broadway, with 140 employees and billings estimated at $30.3 million, will be renamed Lowe Broadway and operate autonomously. Giovanni Cantarella, 60, remains chairman; Philip Zatland, 57, remains president.
